intro: Gurania tessmannii, commonly known as the African sand thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Gurania tessmannii is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
